definition:
If $\mathcal{C}=(\mathcal{A},r,\mathcal{X})$ and
$\mathcal{D}=(\mathcal{B},s,\mathcal{Y})$ are Chu spaces then we say a
pair of functions $f:\mathcal{A}\rightarrow\mathcal{B}$ and
$g:\mathcal{Y}\rightarrow\mathcal{X}$ form a *Chu transform* from
$\mathcal{C}$ to $\mathcal{D}$ if for any
$(a,y)\in \mathcal{A}\times\mathcal{Y}$ we have $r(a,g(y))=s(f(a),y)$.
